description: Join @Meetmrlondoner for ‘Sex, Death and Shopping’. This walking tour explores the seamier side of Soho’s chaotic past and present. Discover streets with dark secrets; stumble upon a plague pit and touch the cloth of London's best tailors.

events.name: Walking tour by qualified London Blue Badge guide
events.notes: The event will be entirely outside and is accessible to all.

facilities: Family activities during open house festival

factsheet.heading: Walking tour - history and contemporary culture
paragraphs: Join Mr Londoner, aka former museum director and Blue Badge guide Antony Robbins, on his ‘Sex, Death and Shopping’ walking tour to explore the seamier side of Soho’s past, present and future.

Discover lost streets with dark secrets; chance upon a massive 14th century plague pit; see the site of London’s most infamous (and well-attended) 19th century brothel and touch the cloth of some of the capital’s very best and most innovative tailors, still plying their ancient trade here - in one of London's most surprising neighbourhoods.

Duration 90 mins 
Max 15 people
Meet 11am Sunday 5 September 2021
@Meetmrlondoner

images.title: Tailoring remains a proud Soho tradition @Meetmrlondoner
Soho was once a gangsters' playground.
Discover the secret of the 'Seven Noses of Soho".

location.address: Liberty of London  - west door, Great Marlborough Street/ Kingly St junction, W1B 5AH
location.meeting_point: Liberty - west door, under the clock,  junction of Kingly and Great Marlborough Street.

name: Sex, Death and Shopping
